articles.description: Many hospitals have been seeing patients who didn’t pay attention to mild symptoms and get themselves tested but were later found to have antibodies against the virus.
articles.content:
Written by Astha Saxena
 | New Delhi | 
Updated: November 26, 2020 9:03:42 am
A team checks temperature during door-to-door Covid-19 survey in New Delhi on Saturday. (Express photo by Praveen Khan… [+3064 chars]

articles.title: This is why Indians are getting flu vaccine amid COVID-19 outbreak - OrissaPOST

articles.author: Press Trust of India | Posted by: Alfea Jamal
articles.title: Covid-19 virus survives on surfaces within thin films: IIT Bombay study - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The Covid-19 virus survives on surfaces by clinging to thin liquid films, according to a study by researchers at IIT-Bombay which provides insights into how the novel coronavirus sustains for hours or days on solid surfaces under ambient conditions

articles.title: Flavanols in cocoa improve brain vascular function, cognition in young, healthy adults, says new study - Firstpost
articles.description: Flavanols are polyphenols belonging to a class of phytonutrients called flavonoids. This phytonutrient has antioxidant potential and so is considered highly beneficial.
articles.content: The phytonutrient called flavanol is quickly gaining quite the reputation for its highly nutritive properties. Flavanols are polyphenols belonging to a class of phytonutrients called flavonoids. This… [+4734 chars]

articles.author: Asian News International | Posted by Jahnavi Gupta
articles.title: Hormone found to switch off hunger could help tackle obesity - Hindustan Times
articles.description: A hormone that can suppress food intake and increase the feeling of fullness in mice has shown similar results in humans and non-human primates, says a new study.
articles.content:
